place.name: LITTLE RAVELEY
place.gazetteerText: RAVELEY (Little), a parish in the district and county of Huntingdon; 4 miles S W by W of Ramsey r.station, and 5¾ N N E of Huntingdon. Post-town, Old Hurst, under Huntingdon. Acres, 760. Real property, £907. Pop., 60. Houses, 13. The manor belongs to the Earl of Sandwich. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of Ely. Value, £50. Patron, the Earl of Sandwich. The church is good, and was originally a chapel. of ease to Bury-by-Ramsey. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
